p: Besides its canonical function in acquired immunity, ERAP1 plays a key role in innate immune regulation, as well. Shedding of cytokine receptors [ 13, 14], induction of natural killer (NK) cell development and function (13) nitric oxide formation [ 15] and triggering of phagocytic activity of splenic DCs and macrophages [ 16] are some of the functions endorsed by ERAP1 in the initial stages of pathogen recognition.
